posts.post_content:
Well you could use [Power Artifact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Power Artifact) *(or even [Heartstone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartstone))* to reduce the cost, in the former case to ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) to take any permanent or ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) to take control of any artifact.  
Another more expensive, yet block-constructed option which Mattmedia already mentioned is [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice), which can be used to skip the first ability and immediately take over anything with the second one (without having to worry about blue mana). [Neurok Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Neurok Transmuter) might find use for reducing the convertion cost to ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) as well, yet is restricted to creatures. An upside from him is that you can also remove the creature's artifact type the same way, which might be useful in case your opponent tries to [shatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shatter) some stuff, including Memnarch itself.  
  
Another great thing about Memnarch is that he has a decent 4/5 body and does not require to tap for any of his abilities, which makes him useful for combat as well, ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Well you could use Power Artifact (or even Heartstone) to reduce the cost, in the former case to to take any permanent or to take control of any artifact.
Another more expensive, yet block-constructed option which Mattmedia already mentioned is Mycosynth Lattice, which can be used to skip the first ability and immediately take over anything with the second one (without having to worry about blue mana). Neurok Transmuter might find use for reducing the convertion cost to as well, yet is restricted to creatures. An upside from him is that you can also remove the creature's artifact type the same way, which might be useful in case your opponent tries to shatter some stuff, including Memnarch itself.

Another great thing about Memnarch is that he has a decent 4/5 body and does not require to tap for any of his abilities, which makes him useful for combat as well, ... (see all)
